utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I guess everybody else is dead... Which means we're totally outnumbered. We got to make up for that in pure firepower.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: You want to raid the feeding area, don't you?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Two boxes of grenades in there. It's our only chance at getting out.

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: Uh, Vince, that place is a death trap.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Lucky for you, I’ve got the mega-blaster. Lee, you go right. Roy, straight down the middle. I'll cover you both.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Where's that cover fire? Mega-blaster, dude. Mega-blaster!

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: Aah! What the hell?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Got it! Vince, where are you?

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: Ah, I can't get them off of me!

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Vince, you d-bag, where are you? Damn it. Damn it.

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: Damn it, Vince. Ahh.

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: That blood look funny to you?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Still working on it. The code's a little janky.

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Hey, boss, you just like watching us get our asses shredded?

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: Yeah, not that you're not hilarious, but we hit the shelves in three months.

utterance.speaker: Roy
utterance.content: Vince?

utterance.speaker: Lee
utterance.content: Vince, what's wrong?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: My hands. They're on fire.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Your NCV test was normal. Rules out carpal tunnel. No evidence of trauma. Your blood work looks normal.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Then what is it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I don't know. I'll arrange to have you transferred to a neurologist.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: A neurologist? Don't you have some famous diagnostics guy? What's he doing?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I quit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You can't quit.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think you're confusing me with Jake Gyllenhaal.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, are you okay?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah, and I want to stay that way. Talked it over with my therapist. I need to change my environment, my habits.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But he cleared you to get your license back.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Which will help immensely with my new job in research. I’ve sent out some resumes. Research means no patients, less pressure.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Well, you just got out. Have you had enough time to think this through?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I know this will affect both of you... And Thirteen... And the one with the nose. I just can't risk coming back here.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That was surprising.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I want to run the department.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You consider waiting until House clears the lobby before you start angling for his job?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's not dead or sentimental and somebody needs to do it.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Not necessarily. Departments of diagnostic medicine don't exist. The only reason we have one is because of House.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You reassigned us, kept us on payroll for three months. You might as well give me a chance.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You're a great doctor. I want you to stay on in neuro. But House was a genius.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: House was an egotistical, pill-popping lawsuit magnet... And a genius. And I worked with him longer than anybody else. I can do this.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You get one shot.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: What's House gonna do?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No idea, but he's gone. So how about we focus on the medicine? What?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You’re the boss. It's kind of sexy.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Here I thought it was just the pants. Uh, diabetic neuropathy?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Hba1c looks fine. Could be hypothyroidism.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No fatigue or weight gain. What about complex regional pain syndrome?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: That’s a good idea.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Let's run with it. Look at that. No House, the job still gets done.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And yet something's missing.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I’m short. He's black. You're gay-ish.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Treat for CRPS. Prep the patient for spinal stimulation.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I don't buy it.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: CRPS isn't that well understood, but –

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I think it's mercury poisoning. I eat a ton of sushi.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And you're currently getting mixed reviews in “Speed-the-Plow” on Broadway. Google it. It's pretty hard to consume enough fish to give yourself mercury poisoning, and it doesn't usually present solely with pain.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: But it can. Check out the “Atlantic Medical Journal”. This guy came in with burning pain caused by, uh, "erythromelalgia", caused by mercury poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Who needs actual doctors when you got the internet?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: No offense, but doctors make mistakes. Medical errors are up 30% this year.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: You should check the rate of patient error.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: There's a ton of information out there. Why wouldn't I educate myself, be my own advocate? CRPS came up in my search too. But I’ve never had any skin discoloration, and my pain is sporadic and not constant. It's got to be worth one lousy blood test.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: You know how House feels about people touching his ball.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. Chase refuses to tell me.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Right. My husband's gay. Witty. I hear you're taking over for House. You're gonna be great. Congratulations.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not permanent.

utterance.speaker: Camreon
utterance.content: Yet. Taub and Thirteen cool with it? He's older than you. She's seen you naked.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not like we haven't been working together for two years now.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Working with is different than working for. You saw House. How was he?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He was... Good. He was honest, took responsibility. It was kind of weird.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: Uh, is Thirteen around? I need her to sign off on her ER transfer.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: She and Taub are doing a spinal stimulation.

utterance.speaker: Cameron
utterance.content: No, they're not. I just dropped a patient in the cath suite, and your guys were not in there.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know, usually spinal stimulation is done with the patient in the room.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He asked us to test his blood for mercury. It's unlikely, but not impossible.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It’s also not what we agreed on.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Testing doesn't hurt. It only takes 20 minutes. I figured it didn't matter.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m thinking I should decide when it matters.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: When you're done marking your territory... Test results. Surprise, surprise. Marcus Webly was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'll handle this.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know it's the right call. Just don't know what to do with my time. And my leg – Pain's flared up since I left Mayfield. Ibuprofen’s barely putting a dent in it.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Right. Doctors the world over treat chronic pain with collections of Hummel figurines.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You already made me get a roommate. Wilson's got one bedroom. I don't think we can get any more connected without unzipping.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Vince, I’m Dr. Foreman, head of diagnostics.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: So you must be the genius' replacement.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I prefer to think of myself as genius 2.0. Your blood tests ruled out mercury poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: What was my mercury level?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 2.8. That means for every deciliter of?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I know what it means. I also know it's above normal. I want mercury chelation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your level isn't elevated enough to produce your symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: You can't know that until we de-elevate it and see if my pain improves. It’s a judgment call.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Based on ten years of medical training? I think you have CRPS. I want to try spinal stimulation.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: So, basically, you want to shove a needle in my spine based on a glorified hunch. I'll stick with the chelation.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you don't want to get better, I think we're done.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: What do you mean "done"?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're not interested in my medical opinion. I’ll move on to my next patient. You'll move on to a doctor willing to run all the unnecessary tests and procedures you want. Or you can stick around and be cured. Makes no difference to me.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I’m glad you changed your mind.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Don’t know about that. Dr. Foreman basically strong-armed me, which is impressive.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Stimulating at 100 hertz. Guess you found him a little more persuasive than two of us – Probably the pants.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: He reminds me of me. Is it supposed to hurt?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Not if we're in correctly. Is it your hands? Your back?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: No, my chest. Can't breathe.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Heart rate's 140, climbing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You need to hold still.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: What did you do?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Deep breaths.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: His lungs are filling with fluid.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Analysis of the fluid from Vince’s lungs shows the lung problem is really a heart problem. He's got a thickened left ventricle.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: When his heart sped up during the procedure, it jacked up the pressure in his lungs, causing pulmonary edema.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Good thing I talked the patient into spinal stimulation.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It did lead us to discovering a new symptom and proved he was wrong about mercury poisoning.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We lucked into that discovery, and we were wrong about CRPS. Ventricular thickening plus neuropathy could equal Lyme disease.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Not without joint pain.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: When is his new game coming out?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Couple months.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He’s probably working nonstop. Might be using more than coffee to power through.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Cocaine use explains the symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: So we search his office for drugs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. We're gonna ask him.

utterance.speaker: Cooking Teacher
utterance.content: In a lot of ways, cooking is like music. Different elements combine to make a symphony.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Difference is that Beethoven’s 5th isn't gonna be poop tomorrow.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: What was my one condition for allowing you to tag along?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Try not to be a jerk. I'm trying. I’m just failing.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Roll your meatballs and keep an open mind.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: How hard are you trying not to make a ball joke right now?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: They're smoking. Your balls.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Ow. No, no. They're browning way too fast.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Blue is the color you got to watch out for.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Enough. My God, they're – they're still raw inside. By the time they're cooked through, the outside will be burned.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I think there's a medicated powder for that. Although, vinegar could work. My o-chem prof talked about how, theoretically, you shouldn't trust the results of a hemoglobin a1c test on a chronically acidotic patient. The acid in the blood slows the reaction between the hemoglobin protein and blood sugar. Browning meat is the same chemical process, which means, it should also be slowed by acid.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: That actually makes sense. You might've... saved my balls.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That's the spirit.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Obviously, the procedure didn't go as planned. The heart problem was unforeseeable, but I still feel responsible. I’m sorry.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Okay. How long you guys been doing it?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think it's best if we kept things professional.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Tough to do now that I’ve seen you rock a leopard-print bikini. Congrats, by the way. Up top.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You hacked my profile page?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Your treatment nearly gave me a heart attack. Figured I’d check if you had the credentials to go with the cojones. One search led to another. Is there a shot of just her? I’m thinking screen saver.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We need to know if you've been using cocaine.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Nope. Dude, you just block everybody, or do you really only have three friends?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We need you to be straight with us. We need to be able to trust you.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I cleaned up my act 12 years ago... After my college roommate ODed.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Search his office.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You think he was lying?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, but I’m not sure.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It was worth asking. If he'd had said yes, it would've saved us a trip.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But he didn't.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You have to forget about him.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The patient?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: House. First, you try acting like him. That doesn't work. So then you try the opposite. Now you're mad because you have to use his move.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I feel like Tom Brady’s backup.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Tom Brady’s backup now makes 10 million dollars. Stop comparing. You can do this by being you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We should still check out his office, talk to his coworkers.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'll get Taub.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And... Thanks. Oh, and dinner tonight at 7:00.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Can we make it 8:00?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Already made a reservation for 7:00.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Hi.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I’m making gnocchi.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Oh, I didn't mean to intrude, I just…

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Cecile’s in my cooking class. She doesn't speak English.

utterance.speaker: Cecile
utterance.content: WHO'S THE BROAD?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: MISSIONARY

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You bake the potatoes instead of boiling them, it's less moisture, fewer gluten bonds, lighter gnocchi.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: You seem good.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Feeling better.

utterance.speaker: Cecile
utterance.content: IF SHE'S A MISSIONARY, WHY DOES SHE DRESS LIKE A HOOKER?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I MEANT THE POSITION.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, I need to talk to you about your leaving the hospital.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I do love a good groveling, but my decision is final.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: That’s fine, as long as I’m not the reason for it. I know that sounds completely narcissistic, but =

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Yeah. But it's not. We flirted. We kissed. I fondled. I hallucinated a night with you and yelled it from a hospital balcony. You're not a narcissist.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: So what am I?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Not the reason I’m leaving.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House... I'm gonna miss you.

utterance.speaker: Cecile
utterance.content: Lady, either kiss him or leave. We got work to do.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You just couldn't keep your trap shut.

utterance.speaker: Cecile
utterance.content: Make the damn gnocchi.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Bye.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I guess you're not in a hurry to get back to the office.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And you are?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm not trying to avoid my boyfriend. I'm a lizard, not an idiot. You've been in a crappy mood since we got in the car.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And you're completely okay with being ordered around by someone who 24 hours ago was basically your equal?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Unlike you, I didn't expect anything different.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The work part, I can get used to. He didn't ask me to go to dinner. He told me we were going. He's never done that before.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: So even the score. Go home tonight, put on some heels, and break him like a pony. You'll feel much better. What?

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Wow, that's one big-ass bird.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's kind of amazing. The way the wings move, it's so real.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Get them off me!

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I know what's wrong with the patient. I'm going to call Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Little help.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Your partner said you studied birds to improve the game animation. Did you touch them?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Can't dissect without touching. It's the best way to understand the anatomy.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's also a good way to contract an infection called psittacosis. We spoke to Dr. Foreman. He wants to start you on antibiotics.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Does that infection cause problems in the... joystick area? I’m kind of stuck in play mode.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes, we get it. She’s very, very pretty.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: It's not her. I mean, it was... When she was here with her boyfriend three hours ago.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You've had an erection for three hours?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: At first, it was just embarrassing, but now it's really starting to hurt. Will the antibiotics help?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm afraid not. This isn't psittacosis.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His erection persisted even with medication. We had to put in a surgical shunt just to drain the blood.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You missed dinner. And a shunt doesn't require both of you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm dedicated. So the Holy Trinity: heart, hands, hose.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Could be Guillain Barre.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Not with normal nerve conduction. Thrombocytosis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: His platelet count isn't that high. Brain tumor makes more sense.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I'm sorry. I just realized... Joint pain and joint pain. Honest, I wasn't laughing because of the obvious tension between the two of you. Erection points to a circulatory problem. I'm with Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It is possible for a brain tumor to cause –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We're going with thrombocytosis.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You're mad I didn't ask you to dinner? How long have we been dating?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It felt like an order. Your tone of voice was—

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: My tone? I'm under a little pressure right now. How about giving me a break?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Look, this is tough for both of us, except I haven't just gotten a promotion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So now you're jealous.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No. I’m just saying don't complain about the burdens of command to your employees.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was complaining to my girlfriend. Who are those guys?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I have no idea.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Meet the competition.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You called another doctor?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Lots of other doctors. Posted my symptoms on the internet. You guys are 0 for 2. I thought I’d look for some backup.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Okay, that guy's an idiot. That doesn't mean they all are.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Neither one of you have privileges at this hospital. Please leave... Now.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: 'Cause he doesn't need one.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We considered that and concluded thrombocytosis is more likely. I'm starting him on hydroxyurea.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: There are no signs of increased ICP. I’m not delaying treatment.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Looks like we need a tiebreaker. Dr. Hadley, what do you think?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I think both theories have merit.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: So, brain tumor, otherwise you'd back your boss/boyfriend. I want an MRI.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fine. I’ll set it up.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Great. You're up. I need a taster. Ragout with pork sausage, beef thigh, no cream.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's a little early. Did you even go to bed last night?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Bed is for sissies, unless you're having sex, in which case... No, bed is still for sissies.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Doesn't this seem a little bit obsessive?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Should've been here when I was butchering the ox. What do you expect? I’m an addict. I turn everything up to eleven.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Yeah. I thought you were trying to tone that down.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. I was trying to find something I could set at eleven without blowing out my eardrums. Star anise with caramelized onions. The sulfur compounds bring out the meat flavor. I couldn't sleep because of my leg. It was either make ragout or go out on the street looking to score.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Good choice. So, so good.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He asked me a question. I answered.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You told me to make my own decisions. I do, and you stab me in the back.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I didn't even say what I really thought. I hedged, and I don't like that I hedged. If I have a legitimate opinion –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Express it in private. In public, the team opinion is your opinion.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Except the team opinion is your opinion.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's my job.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: And what's mine, to lie when I’m asked a direct question?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You would've done it for House. Maybe you just don't want me to succeed. Maybe you just want to kick me again for not asking you to dinner.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: At least when House was being an unbelievable jerk, I could talk to my boyfriend about it.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I may be a jerk, but you're wrong. MRI is clean. Treat for thrombocytosis.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You're early.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: For what?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I knew you'd show up here complaining about Foreman. Thought you'd hold out for another week at least.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I showed up to ask if you've seen thrombocytosis with a platelet count under –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I went crazy, not stupid. I leave, Foreman embraces his inner mugabe.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: What's that?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Embryonali – unhatched chicken egg. I'm gonna suck out some of the yolk and replace it with ragout. By the way, you can tell the other lepers that their absence has been noted.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Cameron didn't come by?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Daddy's little co-dependent is all grown up. Making room for daddy's hot bisexual with boyfriend problems.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's not a problem. It’s, um... Okay. It’s a problem. I mean, I get it, the patient's a nightmare. He posted his case online. It – you know Foreman. You know the situation. How can I get him to tone it down?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Stop being a coward for one thing.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's the one who's afraid of failure.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: At a job that no one before me has ever done. His fears are justified. You're just afraid of giving him control over you, which might work at home. It makes it almost impossible for him to do his job. Pass me those crackers.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're saying this is all my fault?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I'm saying... That you would be happier if you learned when it's okay to give in. What?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You just suggested that I give in so that I can be happy. What did they do to you in there?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Taste this.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Um, good. This might be the best thing I’ve ever eaten. And, yes, I’m including what you're thinking of now. You are an amazing cook!

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I know. And yet, my leg hurts.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Fire her.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I’m not gonna fire her.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Then stop being such a wuss.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I'm not being a wuss.

utterance.speaker: Chaes
utterance.content: Challenging you is part of her job. But when she does it, you take it personally.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: So you're saying this is my fault?

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: I was trying to bury it a little, but, yeah. You’ve got to eliminate either the challenge or the reaction.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Or, we could stick with my original plan. We get drunk and talk about how girls are lame.

utterance.speaker: Chase
utterance.content: Yeah. This problem will go away on its own.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: It's 8:00 in the morning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Coffee ice cream.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: No frittata? No bombolini?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Started thinking about what you said, about me obsessing. Started obsessing about obsessing. Decided to take a day off.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You were enjoying cooking.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: How like a man to think that I enjoy slaving over a hot stove all day while you're off banging secretaries.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You said it was keeping your mind off the pain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That was before I discovered the biggest loser marathon on cable. I like to pretend they can see me eating.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: And your leg?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: It's fine.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: My leg's killing me. Cooking helped for a while. I guess I got bored. My leg started hurting again, then I got worried, and that made the pain worse.

utterance.speaker: Nolan
utterance.content: What are you worried about?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: That nothing's gonna help. That I end up in the very dark place. I'm fine... Just not happy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: What if nothing works? What if nothing gives me more than a few days before my brain starts looking for the next fix, before my leg feels like someone's shoving nails into it? What do I do then?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I brought you a doughnut. The florist was closed.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'll get a vase and put it in water.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You know I’m sorry, right?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I'm sorry too. Do you think, um... We could start over?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That's a fantastic idea.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We're gonna be late.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your boss won't mind.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No way.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: His lymph nodes blew up. He's been treated for thrombocytosis, but there's been no change.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I was wrong.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: God, you are a genius. I’m adding this to my list of symptoms.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That didn't work last time.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Because I didn't think big enough. Now I am offering a $25,000 reward.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Steroids reduced his facial swelling.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Swollen lymph nodes rule out thrombocytosis. How did so many people get my personal email?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The Internet is a magical place. Lymph enlargement makes me think polyarteritis—

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You were saying?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No point in treating the symptom and not the disease.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Your stunt generated quite a few responses. Let's take a look.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I'm way ahead of you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Paraneoplastic syndrome secondary to spinal tumor.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: No. No hypercalcemia, no muscle spasms or incontinence.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You are possessed by the biblical demon "legion."

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: No, no jumping off a cliff in a herd of pigs.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Otherwise it did fit. Graves' disease.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Nope. Thyroid levels are normal.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You want us to spend the next few days shooting down every theory in the world, or can we do our jobs and come up with one that works?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I want you to test me for amyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: That your professional opinion?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: It's the wisdom of crowds. Studies show the collective decision of a group can be more accurate than any individual's decision. I went through my emails. Amyloidosis got the most votes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: If you had amyloidosis, there'd be speckling on your cardiac ultrasound.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: In 100% of cases?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Fine. I'll make you a deal. We'll do a kidney biopsy to test for amyloidosis. When it comes back negative, you pull your case off of the internet and retract the reward. It's either that, or I don't test you at all.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Deal.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If you wanted a quickie, you should've called ahead. I'm a mess.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Came home for lunch.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You have lunch with Cuddy on Tuesdays.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: She was busy.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And you are checking up on me.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You know, you can talk to me. Is that my laundry?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You were running out of socks for me to borrow. we got plenty of underwear, though. I'm fine.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: You said that this morning.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: And consistency proves what? Really. I’m good. I’ll put these in your room.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: ♪You always hurt♪ ♪ The one you love♪

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Biopsy showed deposits in the renal endothelium consistent with amyloidosis.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: The internet was right. Start him on dexamethasone.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Already done. This may not be the best time for this... But I quit. I got an offer to join a friend's surgical practice.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You don't generally get an offer unless you're looking for one.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: I put out some feelers when I found out House wasn't coming back.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: I lobbied to keep the department open so you could keep your job.

utterance.speaker: Taub
utterance.content: Yes. That was incredibly altruistic of you. It's nothing personal. Actually, I think you're doing pretty well. But I came here to work with House.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: He's a jerk. We'll be fine without him. Do you know how many resumes we get every day without even asking?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Might be a few less after Cuddy shuts us down.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The case got solved under your watch. Does it really matter how it happened?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: It matters. What if I’m just not ready for this job?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Okay, you're sad. I could tell you the story about me and my roommate at Sarah Lawrence.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Her name was Lindsey, and she was a cheerleader from Iowa.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I broke my toilet this morning.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: I'll get my tools.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: I blocked the intake valve so I could collect some of House's urine. Cuddy, he was barely limping.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: What did the lab say?

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: The urine was clean for Vicodin. It did, however, contain strange epithelial cells. Further analysis showed they were from a Labrador Retriever.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Damn. He's using.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: No. no.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Vince. Vince. Vince, relax. It's Dr. Foreman.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Kill it! Kill it! No! No! I don't have my blaster!

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: He's hallucinating 'cause he's burning up. Amyloidosis wouldn’t do this.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: The antipyretics didn't work. Hopefully the cold tub will get his temp down. Maybe we should see if anyone's sent in other ideas. Maybe the reward money attract –

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. I’m not letting anyone else jerk us around. The masses were wrong about amyloidosis. They don't know about the fever. I'm going with light-chain deposition disorder. You okay with that?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Yes.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We think you have a disease called LCDD. It causes protein to build up in your organs.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: You think?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: We can't definitely confirm the diagnosis. And our only chance of beating this would be to start you on high-dose chemotherapy. But I do have to warn you that in your condition, it might kill you. Do you want me to get you some more information?

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: You're my doctor. I trust you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No, you don't. You're scared, and you don't want to make this decision. My career is riding on this case... Nowhere near as important as your life. But I think the best shot for both of us is to treat for LCDD.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: Okay.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: All right, let's get you out of this tub and into chemo.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: We know you're back on Vicodin.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: No. The only thing you know is that I’m a genius who got a dog to pee in your toilet. You don't know how I did it or, more interestingly, where I peed.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, you've spent the last three months –

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Et tu, Butte? You got no reason to be here. He's the one I was jerking around.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: Why is your leg better?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Ow. It hurts. Please go away now. If you really think I’m using, how about asking me before taking a wrench to your plumbing?

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House, you're an addict. You can't be surprised if we can't take you at your word.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Fine. Let’s get you some proof. Hide your eyes, ladies.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: House.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: You too.

utterance.speaker: Wilson
utterance.content: My godson made me that mug.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: If the lab says that this is retriever too, please let me know right away. It'd explain my overwhelming desire to wipe my butt on your carpet.

utterance.speaker: Cuddy
utterance.content: Thank you for dragging me into this.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Stop the chemo. He's got Fabry's disease. He was in the tub for an hour. His fingers should have pruned, but they didn't.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Already stopped chemo and confirmed Fabry’s.

utterance.speaker: Vince
utterance.content: I’m glad you both agree, but could somebody loop me in here?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: We assumed the deposits in your kidneys were proteins, but they were fats. Fabry’s makes them build up in your organs, choke your nerves, keep your fingers from pruning in water. It's chronic but manageable.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: How'd you figure it out?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Iodine mumps. His lymph nodes swelled up after the head CT. We thought it was a new symptom, but it wasn't. It was a reaction to the contrast. Iodine mumps takes lymph nodes off the table. Remove that symptom...

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: And that just came to you?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I looked through the online responses again. Someone posted it this morning.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Heard Cuddy made it official. Department’s yours. Congrats. I'm sorry. I went behind your back. On a scale of 1 to 10, how mad are you?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: A 7. And that's stupid. You did the right thing. It's my fault you thought you had to go behind my back.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: I should've stood up to you.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: But you didn't 'cause you didn't want to fight again.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: It's our first case. It’ll take time to adjust.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: What if by the time we get adjusted, we don't like each other anymore?

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: That's not gonna happen.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: You sure? 'Cause ever since I took this job, we've been making each other miserable. I really don't think this is gonna work.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: You're breaking up with me?

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: No. The other night when I thought I was done, you were there. I need you. I don't want to lose you.

utterance.speaker: Thirteen
utterance.content: Why are you...? You're firing me.

utterance.speaker: Foreman
utterance.content: Sorry.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I slipped.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: I solved my old team's case. I was about to take the pills. I went online. I found people posting medical problems, and... My leg stopped hurting.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Oh? I'm supposed to be changing my life. This is not a change.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Says the guy making sand castles in my brain.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: So you're okay with me going online, solving cases?

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: The hospital is part of my old life. If I go back, I might become... who I was before, pills and all.

utterance.speaker: House
utterance.content: Guess we're gonna find out.
